Detailed Description

template<class T>
class Allocator< T >

Allocator is the standard dynamic memory manager of APOXI system.

Member Typedef Documentation

template<class T>
typedef Allocator<T> Allocator< T >::ThisType
 

Member Function Documentation

template<class T>
static T* Allocator< T >::Alloc (  INT  n  )  [inline, static]
 

Allocate memory for n objects of type T. Note that memory is only allocated - ctor of type T wont be executed

Parameters:
n Number of objects to allocate
Returns:
returns a pointer to memory allocated for n instances of type T returns 0 (Null) in error case

template<class T>
static T* Allocator< T >::Alloc (   )  [inline, static]
 

Allocate memory for type T. Note that memory is only allocated - ctor of type T wont be executed

Returns:
returns a pointer to memory allocated for an instance of type T returns 0 (Null) in error case

template<class T>
static void Allocator< T >::Construct (  T *  p,
const T &  val
)  [inline, static]
 

Constructs an object of type T (i.e. calls ctor of T)

Parameters:
p Pointer to memory where object should be constructed
val Initialization value of newly created object

template<class T>
static void Allocator< T >::Destruct (  T *  p  )  [inline, static]
 

Destructs an object of type T (i.e. calls dtor of T)

Parameters:
p Pointer to a valid object of type T, this object must been formaly created with Allocator<T>::Construct

template<class T>
static void Allocator< T >::Free (  T *  p  )  [inline, static]
 

Frees memory for previously allocated by Allocator<T>::Alloc. Note that memory is only freed - dtor of type T wont be executed

Parameters:
p pointer to memory to dellocate, can be 0 (Null)
